Class Simulator

java.lang.Object
Simulator
public class Simulator extends Object
A Life (Game of Life) simulator, first described by British mathematician John Horton Conway in 1970.
Version:
2022.01.06 (1)
Author:
David J. Barnes, Michael KÃ¶lling & Jeffery Raphael

  • Constructor Details

    • Simulator

      public Simulator()
      Construct a simulation field with default size.

    • Simulator

      public Simulator(int depth, int width)
      Create a simulation field with the given size.
      Parameters:
      depth - Depth of the field. Must be greater than zero.
      width - Width of the field. Must be greater than zero.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Execute simulation

    • runLongSimulation

      public void runLongSimulation()
      Run the simulation from its current state for a reasonably long period, (4000 generations).

    • simulate

      public void simulate(int numGenerations)
      Run the simulation from its current state for the given number of generations. Stop before the given number of generations if the simulation ceases to be viable.
      Parameters:
      numGenerations - The number of generations to run for.

    • simOneGeneration

      public void simOneGeneration()
      Run the simulation from its current state for a single generation. Iterate over the whole field updating the state of each life form.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Reset the simulation to a starting position.
